data.description:
In this playbook the analysis of the sender takes place. It searches for specific keywords in the email body and subject, matches autohrized domains, and performs a VIP check. 
The corrolation of the single elements defines a risk score for the sender.

regex_extract_email.description:
Provide a string with one or more email addresses in it to be extracted.
Can be helpful with strings from the To or CC fields of an email: "<other_email@domain.com>, 'Name' <e-mail@domain.com>"
regex_extract_email.label: regex_extract_email
regex_extract_email.name: regex_extract_email

custom_list_value_in_strings.description: Iterates through all items of a custom list to see if any list value (i.e. "sample.com") exists in the input you are comparing it to (i.e "findme.sample.com"). Returns a list of matches, a list of misses, a count of matches, and a count of misses.

fields.description: Name of the custom list. Every string in this list will be compared to see if it is a substring of any of the comparison_strings
fields.label: custom_list
fields.name: custom_list

custom_list_value_in_strings.label: custom_list_value_in_strings
custom_list_value_in_strings.name: custom_list_value_in_strings

noop.description: Do nothing and return nothing. Use this if you want to do something in a custom function setup section or leave a placeholder block in a playbook. This does not sleep or wait and will return as soon as possible.
noop.label: noop
noop.name: noop

25.userCode:
# Write your custom code here...
    import re
    phantom.debug(container_artifact_cef_item_0)
    phantom.debug(extract_email_from_emailheaders_data___domain)
    domain_regex = r'(((?!-))(xn--)?[a-z0-9][a-z0-9-_]{0,61}[a-z0-9]{0,1}\.(xn--)?([a-z0-9\-]{1,61}|[a-z0-9-]{1,30}\.[a-z]{2,}))'
    for domain in re.findall(domain_regex, str(container_artifact_cef_item_0), re.IGNORECASE):
        phantom.debug(domain[0])
        dkim_domain = domain[0]
        
    if dkim_domain == extract_email_from_emailheaders_data___domain[0]:
        phantom.debug('same Domain')
        extract_domain_from_dkim_signature__dkim_domain_check_result = True
        
    else:
        phantom.debug('not same Domainn')
        extract_domain_from_dkim_signature__dkim_domain_check_result = False

noop.description: Do nothing and return nothing. Use this if you want to do something in a custom function setup section or leave a placeholder block in a playbook. This does not sleep or wait and will return as soon as possible.

38.userCode:
# Write your custom code here...
    phantom.debug(create_email_artefact_data_artifact_id[0])
    url = phantom.build_phantom_rest_url('artifact', create_email_artefact_data_artifact_id[0], 'tags')
    response = phantom.requests.get(url,verify=False,)
    phantom.debug("phantom returned status code {} with message {}".format(response.status_code, response.text))
    
    artifatc_tag_list = response.json()['tags']
    phantom.debug('Tags from Artifakts {}'.format(artifatc_tag_list))
    
    # this builds the Tag list
    #lat_list = [item for sublist in artifatc_tag_list for item in sublist]
    #phantom.debug(lat_list)
    
    tag_list = ','.join(artifatc_tag_list)
    
    convert_tag_list_into_string__tag_str_list = tag_list + ', internal'

artifact_create.description: Create a new artifact with the specified attributes.

fields.description: Container which the artifact will be added to.
fields.label: container
fields.name: container

fields.description: The name of the new artifact, which is optional and defaults to "artifact".
fields.label: name
fields.name: name

fields.description: The label of the new artifact, which is optional and defaults to "events"
fields.label: label
fields.name: label

fields.description: The severity of the new artifact, which is optional and defaults to "Medium". Typically this is either "High", "Medium", or "Low".
fields.label: severity
fields.name: severity

fields.description: The name of the CEF field to populate in the artifact, such as "destinationAddress" or "sourceDnsDomain". Required only if cef_value is provided.
fields.label: cef_field
fields.name: cef_field

fields.description: The value of the CEF field to populate in the artifact, such as the IP address, domain name, or file hash. Required only if cef_field is provided.
fields.label: cef_value
fields.name: cef_value

fields.description: The CEF data type of the data in cef_value. For example, this could be "ip", "hash", or "domain". Optional.
fields.label: cef_data_type
fields.name: cef_data_type

fields.description: A comma-separated list of tags to apply to the created artifact, which is optional.
fields.label: tags
fields.name: tags

fields.description: Either "true" or "false", depending on whether or not the new artifact should trigger the execution of any playbooks that are set to active on the label of the container the artifact will be added to. Optional and defaults to "false".
fields.label: run_automation
fields.name: run_automation

fields.description: Optional parameter to modify any extra attributes of the artifact. Input_json will be merged with other inputs. In the event of a conflict, input_json will take precedence.
fields.label: input_json
fields.name: input_json

artifact_create.label: artifact_create
artifact_create.name: artifact_create

noop.description: Do nothing and return nothing. Use this if you want to do something in a custom function setup section or leave a placeholder block in a playbook. This does not sleep or wait and will return as soon as possible.
noop.label: noop
noop.name: noop
